description: Python 3.10+ runtime is available and working
steps: Step 1: Run 'python --version' command
Step 2: Verify version is 3.10 or higher
Step 3: Verify Python can import standard libraries (json, pathlib, subprocess)

description: Docker is installed and can run containers
steps: Step 1: Run 'docker --version' command
Step 2: Verify Docker daemon is running
Step 3: Test with 'docker run hello-world'
Step 4: Verify can pull openroad/orfs:latest image

description: Ray can be initialized and dashboard starts
steps: Step 1: Import ray in Python
Step 2: Call ray.init() with dashboard enabled
Step 3: Verify dashboard URL is accessible at http://localhost:8265
Step 4: Verify ray.shutdown() works cleanly

description: StudyConfig can be loaded from YAML file
steps: Step 1: Create a minimal study_definition.yaml file
Step 2: Load it using StudyConfig.load(path)
Step 3: Verify all required fields are parsed correctly
Step 4: Verify validation passes for valid config

description: Safety domain can be parsed and enforced from config
steps: Step 1: Create config with safety_domain: sandbox
Step 2: Load config and verify domain is set
Step 3: Test with safety_domain: guarded
Step 4: Test with safety_domain: locked
Step 5: Verify ECO class restrictions match domain

description: Stage configuration can be parsed from study YAML
steps: Step 1: Create study with multiple stages
Step 2: Load config and verify stages array is parsed
Step 3: Verify each stage has name, mode, budget, survivors
Step 4: Verify stage eco_classes are parsed as list

description: Rails configuration can be parsed from study YAML
steps: Step 1: Create study with rails section
Step 2: Verify abort rails are parsed (wns_ps, timeout_seconds)
Step 3: Verify stage rails are parsed (failure_rate)
Step 4: Verify study rails are parsed (catastrophic_failures, max_runtime_hours)

description: DockerTrialRunner can execute a basic trial in openroad/orfs container
steps: Step 1: Create DockerTrialRunner instance
Step 2: Prepare a minimal TCL script for OpenROAD
Step 3: Execute trial in container
Step 4: Verify container exits with rc=0
Step 5: Verify trial artifacts are created in working directory

description: Nangate45 base case runs successfully in container
steps: Step 1: Load Nangate45 base snapshot (GCD design)
Step 2: Run STA-only trial with no ECOs
Step 3: Verify OpenROAD completes with rc=0
Step 4: Verify timing_report.txt exists and has content
Step 5: Verify execution completes in under 5 minutes

description: Timing metrics can be parsed from report_checks output for Nangate45
steps: Step 1: Run Nangate45 base case
Step 2: Parse timing_report.txt
Step 3: Extract wns_ps (worst negative slack in picoseconds)
Step 4: Extract tns_ps (total negative slack)
Step 5: Verify metrics are valid numbers (not None or NaN)

description: ASAP7 base case runs successfully with required workarounds
steps: Step 1: Load ASAP7 base snapshot (GCD design)
Step 2: Apply ASAP7-specific workarounds (routing layers, floorplan site, etc.)
Step 3: Run STA-only trial
Step 4: Verify OpenROAD completes with rc=0
Step 5: Verify timing_report.txt exists

description: Sky130 base case runs successfully
steps: Step 1: Load Sky130 base snapshot (Ibex design)
Step 2: Set PDK to sky130A, library to sky130_fd_sc_hd
Step 3: Run STA-only trial
Step 4: Verify OpenROAD completes with rc=0
Step 5: Verify timing_report.txt exists

description: Congestion metrics can be parsed from global_route output for Nangate45
steps: Step 1: Run Nangate45 base case with global_route
Step 2: Parse congestion_report.txt
Step 3: Extract bins_total (total routing bins)
Step 4: Extract bins_hot (bins with overflow)
Step 5: Calculate hot_ratio = bins_hot / bins_total
Step 6: Verify hot_ratio is between 0.0 and 1.0

description: Ray can execute a single trial as a Ray task
steps: Step 1: Initialize Ray cluster
Step 2: Define trial as Ray remote function
Step 3: Submit trial using ray.remote().remote()
Step 4: Wait for completion using ray.get()
Step 5: Verify trial results are returned correctly

description: Ray can execute multiple trials in parallel
steps: Step 1: Initialize Ray cluster
Step 2: Submit 5 trials in parallel as Ray tasks
Step 3: Wait for all to complete using ray.get()
Step 4: Verify all 5 trials completed successfully
Step 5: Verify trials ran in parallel (total time < sum of individual times)

description: Ray Dashboard shows running trials in Jobs tab
steps: Step 1: Start Ray with dashboard enabled
Step 2: Navigate to http://localhost:8265
Step 3: Click on Jobs tab
Step 4: Submit a trial
Step 5: Verify trial appears in Jobs tab with status
Step 6: Verify status updates to completed when done

description: NoOpECO can be defined and generates valid TCL
steps: Step 1: Create NoOpECO instance
Step 2: Call generate_tcl() method
Step 3: Verify TCL contains only comments or timing analysis commands
Step 4: Verify no netlist modifications are included

description: BufferInsertionECO can be defined with parameters
steps: Step 1: Create BufferInsertionECO instance with parameters
Step 2: Set max_buffers parameter
Step 3: Set buffer_cell parameter
Step 4: Call generate_tcl() method
Step 5: Verify TCL contains buffer insertion commands with correct parameters

description: CellResizeECO can be defined and generates valid TCL
steps: Step 1: Create CellResizeECO instance
Step 2: Set size_multiplier parameter
Step 3: Set max_paths parameter
Step 4: Call generate_tcl() method
Step 5: Verify TCL contains repair_design or similar resize commands

description: CellSwapECO can be defined and generates valid TCL
steps: Step 1: Create CellSwapECO instance
Step 2: Set path_count parameter
Step 3: Call generate_tcl() method
Step 4: Verify TCL contains commands to swap cells to faster variants

description: NoOpECO trial runs successfully on Nangate45
steps: Step 1: Create study with NoOpECO
Step 2: Run trial on Nangate45 base case
Step 3: Verify trial completes with rc=0
Step 4: Verify metrics before and after are identical (no changes)
Step 5: Verify artifacts are created

description: BufferInsertionECO trial improves timing on wire-dominated paths
steps: Step 1: Create Nangate45 case with wire-dominated timing issues
Step 2: Run BufferInsertionECO trial
Step 3: Verify trial completes successfully
Step 4: Verify WNS improves (becomes less negative)
Step 5: Verify buffers were added (check design area increase)

description: CellResizeECO trial improves timing on cell-dominated paths
steps: Step 1: Create Nangate45 case with cell-dominated timing issues
Step 2: Run CellResizeECO trial
Step 3: Verify trial completes successfully
Step 4: Verify WNS improves
Step 5: Verify cells were resized (check design area increase)

description: ECO class enforcement works for safety domains
steps: Step 1: Create study with safety_domain: locked
Step 2: Attempt to run ECO with class global_disruptive
Step 3: Verify ECO is rejected before execution
Step 4: Verify error message indicates domain restriction
Step 5: Test that allowed classes (topology_neutral, placement_local) are permitted

description: Abort rail triggers on WNS threshold violation
steps: Step 1: Create study with abort rail wns_ps: -5000
Step 2: Run trial that produces WNS worse than -5000ps
Step 3: Verify trial is aborted immediately
Step 4: Verify abort reason is logged in safety_trace.json
Step 5: Verify trial classified as rail_violation

description: Abort rail triggers on timeout violation
steps: Step 1: Create study with abort rail timeout_seconds: 60
Step 2: Run trial that takes longer than 60 seconds
Step 3: Verify trial is killed after timeout
Step 4: Verify abort reason is logged
Step 5: Verify trial classified as timeout failure

description: Stage rail triggers on high failure rate
steps: Step 1: Create stage with stage rail failure_rate: 0.8
Step 2: Run trials where 80%+ fail
Step 3: Verify stage is terminated early
Step 4: Verify termination reason is logged
Step 5: Verify only current survivors advance to next stage

description: Study rail triggers on catastrophic failure count
steps: Step 1: Create study with study rail catastrophic_failures: 3
Step 2: Trigger 3 catastrophic failures (tool crashes)
Step 3: Verify study is halted completely
Step 4: Verify halt reason is logged in study_summary.json
Step 5: Verify no further trials are executed

description: Single-stage study can execute to completion
steps: Step 1: Create study with 1 stage, budget=10, survivors=3
Step 2: Execute study using StudyExecutor
Step 3: Verify 10 trials are executed
Step 4: Verify top 3 by WNS are selected as survivors
Step 5: Verify study_summary.json contains results

description: Multi-stage study can execute with survivor propagation
steps: Step 1: Create study with 3 stages
Step 2: Stage 0: budget=20, survivors=10
Step 3: Stage 1: budget=15, survivors=5
Step 4: Stage 2: budget=10, survivors=1
Step 5: Execute study and verify only stage 0 survivors advance to stage 1
Step 6: Verify only stage 1 survivors advance to stage 2
Step 7: Verify final winner is selected from stage 2

description: Case naming follows deterministic convention <pdk>_<stage>_<derived>
steps: Step 1: Create study with Nangate45 PDK
Step 2: Run stage 0, verify base case is named nangate45_0_0
Step 3: Create 3 derived cases in stage 1
Step 4: Verify they are named nangate45_1_0, nangate45_1_1, nangate45_1_2
Step 5: Verify naming is consistent across all trials

description: Auto-diagnosis identifies wire-dominated timing issues
steps: Step 1: Create case with wire-dominated timing violations
Step 2: Run auto-diagnosis on metrics
Step 3: Verify dominant_issue is set to 'wire_dominated'
Step 4: Verify suggested ECOs include insert_buffers
Step 5: Verify confidence score is provided

description: Auto-diagnosis identifies cell-dominated timing issues
steps: Step 1: Create case with cell-dominated timing violations
Step 2: Run auto-diagnosis
Step 3: Verify dominant_issue is set to 'cell_dominated'
Step 4: Verify suggested ECOs include resize_critical_drivers
Step 5: Verify confidence score is provided

description: Auto-diagnosis identifies congestion hotspots
steps: Step 1: Create case with routing congestion (hot_ratio > 0.3)
Step 2: Run auto-diagnosis
Step 3: Verify hotspots are identified with bounding boxes
Step 4: Verify severity is classified (critical, moderate, low)
Step 5: Verify suggested ECOs include spread_dense_region or reroute_congested_nets

description: Auto-diagnosis produces combined diagnosis report prioritizing primary issue
steps: Step 1: Create case with both timing and congestion issues
Step 2: Run auto-diagnosis
Step 3: Verify primary_issue is identified (timing or congestion)
Step 4: Verify secondary_issue is identified
Step 5: Verify ECO priority queue is generated with addresses field
Step 6: Verify recommended strategy is provided with reasoning

description: Trial failure classification works for tool crashes
steps: Step 1: Force OpenROAD to crash (invalid TCL command)
Step 2: Run trial and capture exit code
Step 3: Verify failure type is classified as 'tool_crash'
Step 4: Verify severity is 'critical'
Step 5: Verify failure is logged in safety_trace.json

description: Trial failure classification works for parse failures
steps: Step 1: Run trial that produces corrupted output file
Step 2: Attempt to parse metrics
Step 3: Verify failure type is classified as 'parse_failure'
Step 4: Verify severity is 'high'
Step 5: Verify failure is logged

description: Trial failure classification works for metric regressions
steps: Step 1: Run ECO that makes WNS significantly worse
Step 2: Verify failure type is classified as 'metric_regression'
Step 3: Verify severity is 'medium'
Step 4: Verify delta metrics are logged

description: ECO priors track unknown state by default
steps: Step 1: Create new study with ECO that has never been run
Step 2: Check ECO prior state
Step 3: Verify state is 'unknown'
Step 4: Verify no historical effectiveness data exists

description: ECO priors update to trusted after consistent improvements
steps: Step 1: Run ECO 5 times successfully with WNS improvements
Step 2: Check ECO prior state
Step 3: Verify state transitions to 'trusted'
Step 4: Verify success_rate and avg_improvement are tracked

description: ECO priors update to suspicious after failures
steps: Step 1: Run ECO 5 times with 4 failures
Step 2: Check ECO prior state
Step 3: Verify state transitions to 'suspicious'
Step 4: Verify failure_rate is tracked
Step 5: Verify ECO is deprioritized in future trials

description: ECO priors update to mixed after variable results
steps: Step 1: Run ECO 10 times with 6 successes, 4 failures
Step 2: Check ECO prior state
Step 3: Verify state is 'mixed'
Step 4: Verify success_rate is around 0.6

description: Warm start can load priors from previous study
steps: Step 1: Complete study A with ECO priors established
Step 2: Create study B with warm_start mode referencing study A
Step 3: Load study B config
Step 4: Verify priors from study A are available in study B
Step 5: Verify weight parameter is applied correctly

description: Survivor selection using pure_top_n works correctly
steps: Step 1: Create stage with survivor_selection method: pure_top_n, count: 5
Step 2: Run 20 trials with varying WNS
Step 3: Select survivors
Step 4: Verify exactly 5 cases with best WNS are selected
Step 5: Verify selection is deterministic (repeated runs select same cases)

description: Survivor selection using diverse_top_n maintains diversity
steps: Step 1: Create stage with survivor_selection method: diverse_top_n
Step 2: Set min_diversity: 0.3 (ECO path distance)
Step 3: Run 20 trials with varying ECO sequences
Step 4: Select survivors
Step 5: Verify survivors have diverse ECO paths (min_diversity constraint met)
Step 6: Verify always_keep_best preserves top performer

description: Survivor selection using pareto_front selects non-dominated cases
steps: Step 1: Create stage with multi-objective optimization (WNS vs hot_ratio)
Step 2: Set survivor_selection method: pareto_front
Step 3: Run 20 trials with varying WNS and hot_ratio
Step 4: Select survivors
Step 5: Verify all survivors are on Pareto frontier
Step 6: Verify no dominated cases are selected

description: Objective function supports pareto mode
steps: Step 1: Create study with objective mode: pareto
Step 2: Set primary: wns_ps, secondary: hot_ratio
Step 3: Run trials with trade-offs between metrics
Step 4: Verify Pareto frontier is computed correctly
Step 5: Verify both objectives are considered

description: Objective function supports weighted_sum mode
steps: Step 1: Create study with objective mode: weighted_sum
Step 2: Set weights: [0.7, 0.3] for wns_ps and hot_ratio
Step 3: Run trials
Step 4: Verify ranking uses weighted sum: 0.7*wns + 0.3*hot_ratio
Step 5: Verify survivors are selected by combined score

description: Objective function supports lexicographic mode
steps: Step 1: Create study with objective mode: lexicographic
Step 2: Set primary: wns_ps (optimized first), secondary: hot_ratio (tiebreaker)
Step 3: Run trials
Step 4: Verify primary metric is optimized first
Step 5: Verify secondary is used only for ties in primary

description: Checkpointing can save study state per stage
steps: Step 1: Create study with checkpointing enabled, interval: per_stage
Step 2: Run stage 0 to completion
Step 3: Verify checkpoint file is created in checkpoints/study_name/stage_0_complete.noodle
Step 4: Run stage 1 to completion
Step 5: Verify stage_1_complete.noodle exists
Step 6: Verify latest symlink points to most recent checkpoint

description: Study can resume from latest checkpoint
steps: Step 1: Run study partway through (complete stage 0)
Step 2: Interrupt study
Step 3: Resume using 'noodle2 resume --study <name>'
Step 4: Verify study continues from stage 1 (not from beginning)
Step 5: Verify previous stage results are preserved

description: Study can resume from specific checkpoint file
steps: Step 1: Complete multi-stage study with checkpoints
Step 2: Resume from earlier checkpoint using '--checkpoint <path>'
Step 3: Verify study restarts from that checkpoint's stage
Step 4: Verify later stage results are discarded/overwritten

description: Artifact bundle structure is created correctly per trial
steps: Step 1: Run a single trial
Step 2: Navigate to artifacts/<study_name>/<case_name>/<stage>/<trial>/
Step 3: Verify artifact_index.json exists
Step 4: Verify metrics.json exists with parsed metrics
Step 5: Verify logs/ directory contains openroad.log
Step 6: Verify all paths in artifact_index.json are valid

description: Artifact index contains correct trial metadata
steps: Step 1: Run trial with ECO applied
Step 2: Load artifact_index.json
Step 3: Verify trial_id, case, stage fields are correct
Step 4: Verify eco_applied and eco_parameters are logged
Step 5: Verify metrics and metrics_delta are present

description: Xvfb headless display can be started in container
steps: Step 1: Start container with Xvfb installed
Step 2: Run 'Xvfb :99 -screen 0 1024x768x24 &'
Step 3: Set DISPLAY=:99
Step 4: Verify display is available (test with simple X command)
Step 5: Verify OpenROAD GUI commands can run headlessly

description: Placement density heatmap CSV can be exported from OpenROAD GUI
steps: Step 1: Load design in OpenROAD with GUI in headless mode
Step 2: Execute: gui::select_heatmap 'Placement Density'
Step 3: Execute: gui::dump_heatmap placement_density heatmaps/placement_density.csv
Step 4: Verify CSV file exists
Step 5: Verify CSV contains grid data (numbers, not text)

description: Routing congestion heatmap CSV can be exported from OpenROAD GUI
steps: Step 1: Load design and run global_route
Step 2: Execute: gui::select_heatmap 'Routing Congestion'
Step 3: Execute: gui::dump_heatmap routing_congestion heatmaps/routing_congestion.csv
Step 4: Verify CSV file exists
Step 5: Verify CSV contains congestion grid data

description: RUDY heatmap CSV can be exported from OpenROAD GUI
steps: Step 1: Load design in OpenROAD GUI
Step 2: Execute: gui::select_heatmap 'RUDY'
Step 3: Execute: gui::dump_heatmap rudy heatmaps/rudy.csv
Step 4: Verify CSV file exists
Step 5: Verify CSV contains wire density estimate data

description: Heatmap CSV can be converted to PNG using matplotlib
steps: Step 1: Export placement_density.csv from OpenROAD
Step 2: Load CSV using numpy.loadtxt()
Step 3: Create matplotlib figure with imshow()
Step 4: Save as PNG using plt.savefig()
Step 5: Verify PNG file is valid image (not text file)
Step 6: Verify image shows heatmap visualization

description: Differential heatmap can be computed and visualized
steps: Step 1: Export heatmap CSV for parent case (before ECO)
Step 2: Export heatmap CSV for derived case (after ECO)
Step 3: Compute difference: diff = after - before
Step 4: Create matplotlib visualization with diverging colormap (red=worse, green=better)
Step 5: Save differential heatmap as PNG
Step 6: Verify PNG shows regions of improvement vs degradation

description: Differential summary quantifies improvement per region
steps: Step 1: Compute differential heatmap
Step 2: Count bins with delta < 0 (improved)
Step 3: Count bins with delta > 0 (worsened)
Step 4: Count unchanged bins
Step 5: Calculate net_improvement_pct
Step 6: Save summary as JSON with improved_bins, worsened_bins, net_improvement_pct

description: Critical path overlay can be generated on heatmap
steps: Step 1: Extract top N critical paths from timing report
Step 2: Parse path coordinates (cell locations)
Step 3: Load heatmap as background
Step 4: Overlay critical paths as lines/arrows on heatmap
Step 5: Save as PNG with both heatmap and path overlay
Step 6: Verify paths are visible on visualization

description: Hotspot annotation can be added to congestion heatmap
steps: Step 1: Identify congestion hotspots from diagnosis
Step 2: Load routing congestion heatmap
Step 3: Draw bounding boxes around hotspot regions
Step 4: Add labels with hotspot ID and severity
Step 5: Save annotated heatmap as PNG
Step 6: Verify hotspots are clearly marked

description: Pareto frontier can be visualized as 2D scatter plot
steps: Step 1: Run multi-objective study with WNS vs hot_ratio
Step 2: Collect all trial results
Step 3: Plot WNS (x-axis) vs hot_ratio (y-axis)
Step 4: Mark Pareto-optimal points distinctly (e.g., filled circles)
Step 5: Mark dominated points differently (e.g., X markers)
Step 6: Save as PNG and verify frontier is visible

description: Pareto evolution can be animated across stages
steps: Step 1: Generate Pareto frontier plot for each stage
Step 2: Save each as pareto_frontier_stage_N.png
Step 3: Combine frames into animated GIF
Step 4: Verify GIF shows frontier progression over stages
Step 5: Verify animation loops correctly

description: Improvement trajectory chart shows WNS over stages
steps: Step 1: Run multi-stage study
Step 2: Track best, median, worst WNS per stage
Step 3: Plot WNS (y-axis) vs Stage (x-axis)
Step 4: Show best/median/worst as separate lines or bands
Step 5: Save as PNG
Step 6: Verify trajectory shows improvement trend

description: Stage progression summary visualization shows trial counts and metric deltas
steps: Step 1: Run multi-stage study
Step 2: For each stage, summarize: trial count, survivors, WNS improvement, hot_ratio improvement
Step 3: Create visual summary (boxes showing stage flow)
Step 4: Save as PNG
Step 5: Verify all stages are represented with key metrics

description: ECO success rate chart visualizes effectiveness per ECO
steps: Step 1: Run study with multiple ECOs
Step 2: Compute success rate per ECO from priors
Step 3: Create bar chart with ECO names (x-axis) vs success rate (y-axis)
Step 4: Save as PNG
Step 5: Verify chart shows which ECOs are most effective

description: Study summary JSON contains aggregate statistics
steps: Step 1: Complete a study
Step 2: Load study_summary.json
Step 3: Verify contains: total trials, successful trials, ECO success rate, runtime, stages to converge
Step 4: Verify contains final metrics (WNS, TNS, hot_ratio)
Step 5: Verify contains improvement deltas from baseline

description: Run legality report is generated before study execution
steps: Step 1: Create study config
Step 2: Request legality check
Step 3: Verify report includes: safety domain, proposed ECO classes, applicable rails, abort criteria
Step 4: Verify illegal configurations are flagged with reason

description: Illegal run is rejected before consuming compute
steps: Step 1: Create study with safety_domain: locked and ECO class: global_disruptive
Step 2: Attempt to start study
Step 3: Verify study is rejected immediately
Step 4: Verify no trials are executed
Step 5: Verify rejection reason is clear in error message

description: Compound ECO can combine multiple ECOs into single unit
steps: Step 1: Define compound ECO with 2+ component ECOs
Step 2: Set apply_order: sequential
Step 3: Generate TCL
Step 4: Verify TCL contains all component ECOs in correct order
Step 5: Verify eco_class is inherited from most restrictive component

description: Compound ECO supports rollback_on_failure modes
steps: Step 1: Create compound ECO with rollback_on_failure: all
Step 2: Force one component ECO to fail
Step 3: Verify all components are rolled back
Step 4: Test rollback_on_failure: partial (rollback failed component only)
Step 5: Test rollback_on_failure: none (no rollback)

description: ECO preconditions can gate ECO application
steps: Step 1: Create ECO with precondition: requires_timing_issue: true
Step 2: Run on case with no timing violations
Step 3: Verify ECO is skipped (precondition not met)
Step 4: Run on case with timing violations
Step 5: Verify ECO is applied (precondition met)

description: ECO postconditions can verify expected effects
steps: Step 1: Create ECO with postcondition: wns_must_improve: true
Step 2: Run ECO that worsens WNS
Step 3: Verify postcondition check fails
Step 4: Classify failure as postcondition_failure
Step 5: Update ECO prior state based on postcondition failure

description: Nangate45 smoke test passes completely
steps: Step 1: Run 'noodle2 run --study nangate45_smoke --eco noop'
Step 2: Verify rc=0
Step 3: Verify wns_ps is present in metrics.json
Step 4: Verify artifacts are created in correct directory structure
Step 5: Verify all required heatmaps are generated (placement_density, routing_congestion)
Step 6: Verify execution completes within 5 minutes

description: ASAP7 smoke test passes with workarounds
steps: Step 1: Run 'noodle2 run --study asap7_smoke --eco noop'
Step 2: Verify ASAP7 workarounds are automatically applied
Step 3: Verify rc=0
Step 4: Verify wns_ps is present
Step 5: Verify artifacts and heatmaps are created
Step 6: Verify execution completes within 5 minutes

description: Sky130 smoke test passes
steps: Step 1: Run 'noodle2 run --study sky130_smoke --eco noop'
Step 2: Verify rc=0
Step 3: Verify wns_ps is present
Step 4: Verify artifacts and heatmaps are created
Step 5: Verify execution completes within 5 minutes

description: Study comparison can compare two completed studies
steps: Step 1: Complete study A and study B
Step 2: Run 'noodle2 compare --study1 A --study2 B'
Step 3: Verify comparison output shows: overall metrics delta, ECO effectiveness comparison, key differences
Step 4: Verify visualizations are generated (pareto_comparison.png, trajectory_comparison.png)
Step 5: Verify delta percentages are calculated correctly

description: Trial replay can re-execute specific trial with same parameters
steps: Step 1: Run study and note a specific trial ID
Step 2: Run 'noodle2 replay --study <name> --case <case> --verbose'
Step 3: Verify trial is re-executed with same ECO and parameters
Step 4: Verify detailed output is shown (verbose mode)
Step 5: Verify results match original trial

description: Trial replay can modify ECO parameters for debugging
steps: Step 1: Note a trial that used BufferInsertionECO with max_buffers=50
Step 2: Replay with '--param max_buffers=100'
Step 3: Verify trial runs with modified parameter
Step 4: Verify results differ from original
Step 5: Verify modified parameters are logged

description: Debug report can be generated for failed trial
steps: Step 1: Run trial that fails
Step 2: Run 'noodle2 debug --case <case> --output debug_report/'
Step 3: Verify debug_report/ contains: execution_trace.json, tcl_commands.log, openroad_stdout.log, openroad_stderr.log
Step 4: Verify metrics_before.json and metrics_after.json are present
Step 5: Verify all_heatmaps/ directory contains full visualization set

description: Nangate45 extreme demo runs end-to-end with real execution
steps: Step 1: Run ./demo_nangate45_extreme.sh
Step 2: Verify starting state has WNS ~ -2000ps, hot_ratio > 0.3
Step 3: Verify auto-diagnosis identifies issues correctly
Step 4: Verify multi-stage ECO application (3+ stages)
Step 5: Verify all artifacts are generated (no placeholders)
Step 6: Verify final WNS improves by >50%, hot_ratio < 0.1
Step 7: Verify all visualizations are real PNG images
Step 8: Verify summary.json shows execution_mode: ACTUAL_EXECUTION, mocking: false
Step 9: Verify execution completes within 30 minutes

description: ASAP7 extreme demo runs end-to-end with real execution
steps: Step 1: Run ./demo_asap7_extreme.sh
Step 2: Verify ASAP7 workarounds are applied automatically
Step 3: Verify STA-first staging strategy
Step 4: Verify WNS improves by >40%, hot_ratio reduces >50%
Step 5: Verify all visualizations are generated
Step 6: Verify summary.json shows mocking: false
Step 7: Verify execution completes within 60 minutes

description: Sky130 extreme demo runs end-to-end with real execution
steps: Step 1: Run ./demo_sky130_extreme.sh
Step 2: Verify Ibex design runs successfully
Step 3: Verify WNS improves by >50%, hot_ratio reduces >60%
Step 4: Verify full observability stack is functional
Step 5: Verify complete audit trail is generated
Step 6: Verify summary.json shows mocking: false
Step 7: Verify execution completes within 45 minutes

description: Doom detection identifies metric-hopeless cases and terminates them
steps: Step 1: Create a case with WNS < -10000ps (hopeless threshold)
Step 2: Run doom detector on the case metrics
Step 3: Verify doom_type is metric_hopeless
Step 4: Verify case is marked for termination
Step 5: Verify doom reason is logged in study output

description: Doom detection identifies trajectory-doomed cases after stagnation
steps: Step 1: Create a case with 3 consecutive stages showing <2% improvement
Step 2: Run doom detector trajectory analysis
Step 3: Verify doom_type is trajectory_doom
Step 4: Verify stagnation trigger is correctly identified
Step 5: Verify case termination decision is made

description: Doom detection identifies ECO exhaustion when all ECOs failed or suspicious
steps: Step 1: Create a study where all applicable ECOs have failed
Step 2: Mark all ECO priors as suspicious
Step 3: Run doom detector eco_exhaustion check
Step 4: Verify doom_type is eco_exhaustion
Step 5: Verify study terminates with ECO gap report

description: Doom response logs compute saved and provides recommendations
steps: Step 1: Trigger a doom condition on a case
Step 2: Verify doom classification JSON is created
Step 3: Verify compute_saved_trials count is calculated
Step 4: Verify recommendation message is included
Step 5: Verify doom event appears in study summary

description: Cross-project prior repository can persist priors to SQLite database
steps: Step 1: Initialize PriorRepository with ~/.noodle2/priors/ path
Step 2: Store ECO prior data (name, success_rate, average_improvement)
Step 3: Verify priors.db file is created
Step 4: Query priors from database
Step 5: Verify data integrity across sessions

description: Priors can be exported from completed study to JSON file
steps: Step 1: Complete a study with tracked ECO priors
Step 2: Run noodle2 priors export --study <name> --output priors.json
Step 3: Verify JSON file is created with correct schema
Step 4: Verify eco_priors section contains all ECOs with statistics
Step 5: Verify export_timestamp and source_study metadata

description: Priors can be imported into repository with configurable weight
steps: Step 1: Export priors from a completed study
Step 2: Run noodle2 priors import --file priors.json --weight 0.8
Step 3: Verify priors are merged into repository
Step 4: Verify weight is applied correctly in aggregation
Step 5: Verify imported priors are queryable

description: Prior repository supports cross-project aggregation with decay
steps: Step 1: Import priors from multiple projects with different weights
Step 2: Configure decay_by_age with 30-day half-life
Step 3: Query aggregated prior for an ECO
Step 4: Verify weighted_average is computed correctly
Step 5: Verify older priors have reduced weight due to decay

description: Prior repository tracks anti-patterns and failure modes
steps: Step 1: Track ECO failures with context (e.g., resize on congested region)
Step 2: Identify anti-pattern when failure_rate > 0.7
Step 3: Verify anti-pattern is stored with pattern description
Step 4: Verify recommendation is generated
Step 5: Verify anti-patterns are included in prior exports

description: Immutable design rules can protect macro locations from ECO modification
steps: Step 1: Configure immutable_rules.structural.macro_locations: true
Step 2: Define an ECO that attempts to move a macro
Step 3: Run legality check before ECO execution
Step 4: Verify ECO is BLOCKED with immutable_violation error
Step 5: Verify violation severity is critical

description: Immutable design rules can protect specific nets by pattern
steps: Step 1: Configure protected_nets: [clk*, reset*, vdd*, vss*]
Step 2: Define an ECO that attempts to modify a clock net
Step 3: Run mutation permission check
Step 4: Verify ECO is blocked with net protection violation
Step 5: Verify non-protected nets can still be modified

description: Immutable design rules can protect specific cells by pattern or instance
steps: Step 1: Configure protected_cells with patterns (*_macro, pad_*) and instances
Step 2: Define an ECO that attempts to resize a protected cell
Step 3: Run mutation permission check
Step 4: Verify ECO is blocked for protected cells
Step 5: Verify standard cells can still be modified per ECO class

description: Mutation permissions matrix enforces ECO class restrictions
steps: Step 1: Define mutation permission matrix for each element type vs ECO class
Step 2: Attempt topology_neutral ECO on standard cell (should fail resize)
Step 3: Attempt placement_local ECO on standard cell (should allow resize/move)
Step 4: Attempt any ECO on I/O pads (should fail for all classes)
Step 5: Verify global_disruptive ECO on macro requires approval

description: Ray Dashboard is mandatory for demos and starts with correct configuration
steps: Step 1: Run demo startup sequence
Step 2: Verify ray.init() includes dashboard_host=0.0.0.0 and dashboard_port=8265
Step 3: Wait for dashboard to be accessible within 30 seconds
Step 4: Verify dashboard URL is printed prominently to console
Step 5: Verify demo blocks if dashboard fails to start

description: Ray Dashboard shows trial execution metrics in real-time during demos
steps: Step 1: Start demo with Ray Dashboard running
Step 2: Navigate to Jobs tab in dashboard at http://localhost:8265
Step 3: Verify running trials appear in real-time
Step 4: Verify completed trials are shown with status
Step 5: Verify Cluster tab shows CPU/Memory usage updating every second

description: Stages can include human approval gates that require review before proceeding
steps: Step 1: Define a stage with type: human_approval in study config
Step 2: Configure timeout_hours, required_approvers, and message
Step 3: Run study to approval gate stage
Step 4: Verify study pauses and displays approval request with summary
Step 5: Verify subsequent stage only runs after approval received

description: Demo scripts execute with ACTUAL_EXECUTION mode and no mocking
steps: Step 1: Run demo script (demo_nangate45_extreme.sh)
Step 2: Verify summary.json contains execution_mode: ACTUAL_EXECUTION
Step 3: Verify summary.json contains mocking: false
Step 4: Verify summary.json contains placeholders: false
Step 5: Verify all trials execute real OpenROAD commands

description: All PNG visualization files are real images generated by matplotlib, not text
steps: Step 1: Generate heatmap visualizations from demo
Step 2: Verify all .png files have size > 1000 bytes
Step 3: Run file <png> and verify file type is PNG image data
Step 4: Verify png files can be opened by image viewers
Step 5: Run find demo_output -name *.png -size 0 and verify no results

description: ECO execution actually modifies design ODB and produces different metrics
steps: Step 1: Run multiple trials with different ECO parameters
Step 2: Verify each trial produces modified_odb_path distinct from input
Step 3: Verify jq .wns_ps artifacts/*/trial_*/metrics.json | sort -u | wc -l > 1
Step 4: Verify trial scripts contain actual ECO commands (repair_timing, repair_design)
Step 5: Verify ODB MD5 hashes differ between trials

description: Modified ODB snapshots propagate between stages as input to next stage
steps: Step 1: Run multi-stage study with ECO modifications
Step 2: Verify stage 0 survivors have modified_odb_path set
Step 3: Verify stage 1 uses modified_odb_path as snapshot_path (not original)
Step 4: Verify Case lineage tracks which parent ODB was used
Step 5: Verify final case represents accumulated modifications

description: Extreme snapshots are generated with actual extreme violations (WNS < -1500ps)
steps: Step 1: Run generate_extreme_snapshots.tcl for Nangate45
Step 2: Verify extreme ODB file is created
Step 3: Verify MD5 hash differs from base case ODB
Step 4: Load extreme ODB and check WNS
Step 5: Verify WNS < -1500ps for Nangate45 extreme

description: Extreme snapshots use high utilization and aggressive timing to create real violations
steps: Step 1: Configure extreme snapshot generation with utilization >= 0.85
Step 2: Set aggressive clock period (e.g., 0.3ns for Nangate45)
Step 3: Run placement with timing-driven mode under aggressive constraints
Step 4: Verify hot_ratio > 0.3 for congestion pressure
Step 5: Verify both timing and congestion violations exist

description: CellResizeECO is implemented using OpenROAD repair_design command
steps: Step 1: Define CellResizeECO with parameters (max_wire_length, buffer_cell, max_util)
Step 2: Generate TCL script using generate_tcl()
Step 3: Verify TCL contains repair_design command with correct parameters
Step 4: Execute ECO in trial
Step 5: Verify cell sizes change and design area is reported

description: CellSwapECO is implemented to swap cells to faster or slower variants
steps: Step 1: Define CellSwapECO with target cell variant (faster/slower)
Step 2: Identify cells on critical paths
Step 3: Generate TCL to swap cells using OpenROAD commands
Step 4: Execute ECO in trial
Step 5: Verify cell instances are swapped and timing changes

description: Trial configs are generated with varied ECO parameters for differentiation
steps: Step 1: Define generate_trial_configs function for a stage
Step 2: Create N trial configs with varying parameters (e.g., size_multiplier: 1.2, 1.3, 1.4)
Step 3: Verify each config has unique eco_params
Step 4: Execute trials and verify metrics differ
Step 5: Verify parameter sweep produces observable effect gradient

description: Timing path breakdown extracts actual wire vs cell delay from report_checks
steps: Step 1: Run report_checks with -fields {fanout cap slew cell net} -digits 4
Step 2: Parse output to extract cell delays and net delays separately
Step 3: Sum cell_delay and wire_delay
Step 4: Calculate wire_dominated = (wire_delay > 0.65 * total)
Step 5: Verify classification matches actual path characteristics

description: Heatmap generation loads real CSV data from OpenROAD and creates PNG with matplotlib
steps: Step 1: Export heatmap CSV from OpenROAD using gui::dump_heatmap
Step 2: Load CSV data using numpy.loadtxt
Step 3: Create matplotlib figure with imshow(data, cmap=hot)
Step 4: Save as PNG using plt.savefig with dpi=150
Step 5: Verify PNG file size > 10KB and is valid image

description: Congestion metrics are parsed from actual global_route -congestion_report_file output
steps: Step 1: Run global_route -congestion_report_file congestion.rpt
Step 2: Parse congestion.rpt to extract bins_total and bins_hot
Step 3: Calculate hot_ratio = bins_hot / bins_total
Step 4: Extract layer_breakdown with per-layer overflow counts
Step 5: Verify metrics match actual routing congestion

description: DoomDetector class implements all doom check methods and decision logic
steps: Step 1: Implement DoomDetector.__init__ with DoomConfig
Step 2: Implement check_doom method with metric, trajectory, and eco_exhaustion checks
Step 3: Implement _check_stagnation helper for trajectory analysis
Step 4: Return DoomClassification with doom_type, trigger, and action
Step 5: Integrate with executor to actually terminate doomed cases

description: Nangate45 extreme demo achieves >50% WNS improvement from initial < -1500ps
steps: Step 1: Verify initial state has WNS < -1500ps
Step 2: Run demo_nangate45_extreme.sh to completion
Step 3: Measure initial and final WNS from summary.json
Step 4: Calculate improvement_pct = (initial - final) / abs(initial) * 100
Step 5: Verify improvement_pct > 50%

description: Nangate45 extreme demo reduces hot_ratio by >60% from initial > 0.3
steps: Step 1: Verify initial state has hot_ratio > 0.3
Step 2: Run demo to completion
Step 3: Measure initial and final hot_ratio
Step 4: Calculate reduction_pct = (initial - final) / initial * 100
Step 5: Verify reduction_pct > 60%

description: Demo console output shows ECO application with before/after WNS and improvement percentage
steps: Step 1: Run demo and capture console output
Step 2: Verify output contains [ECO] Applied <eco_name> to <case>
Step 3: Verify output shows WNS Before: X ps → After: Y ps (Z% improvement)
Step 4: Verify multiple ECO applications are logged
Step 5: Verify improvement percentages are calculated correctly

description: Demo console output shows doom termination with compute saved
steps: Step 1: Run demo and capture console output
Step 2: Verify output contains [DOOM] <case> terminated: <doom_type>
Step 3: Verify output shows Compute saved: ~X trials
Step 4: Verify doom events are logged to study summary
Step 5: Verify at least 1 doom event occurs per demo

description: Demo console output shows prior state updates with success/failure counts
steps: Step 1: Run demo and capture console output
Step 2: Verify output contains [PRIOR] <eco_name>: XS/YF -> state=<state>
Step 3: Verify success (S) and failure (F) counts are tracked
Step 4: Verify state transitions (unknown -> trusted/suspicious/mixed)
Step 5: Verify prior updates appear after each trial

description: Prior repository database file exists at ~/.noodle2/priors/priors.db after demo
steps: Step 1: Run demo to completion
Step 2: Check if ~/.noodle2/priors/priors.db file exists
Step 3: Verify file is a valid SQLite database
Step 4: Query database to verify ECO prior records exist
Step 5: Verify priors persist across demo runs
